contentrichtext.text: {{Use dmy dates|date=April 2012}} {{Infobox settlement |official_name = Laiuse |native_name = |pushpin_map =Estonia |mapsize =200px |coordinates_display = inline,title |coordinates_region = EE |subdivision_type = Country |subdivision_name = [[Estonia]] |subdivision_type1 = [[Counties of Estonia|County]] |subdivision_name1 = [[Jõgeva County]] |leader_title = |leader_name = |established_title = |established_date = |area_total_km2 = |area_footnotes = | population_as_of = [[2011 Estonia Census|2011 Census]]<ref name="2011census"/> |population_total = 371 |population_density_km2 = |timezone =[[Eastern European Time|EET]] |utc_offset = +2 |timezone_DST = |utc_offset_DST = |latd=58 |latm=47 |lats=04 |latNS=N |longd=26|longm= 29|longs=50 |longEW=E |area_code = |website = }} '''Laiuse''' ({{lang-de|link=no|Lais}}) is a [[Populated places in Estonia|small borough]] (''{{lang|et|alevik}}'') in [[Estonia]]. It is located in [[Jõgeva County]] and is a part of [[Jõgeva Parish]]. As of [[2011 Estonia Census|2011 Census]], the settlement's population was 371.<ref name=2011census>{{cite web|title=Population by place of residence (settlement), sex and age|url=http://pub.stat.ee/px-web.2001/Dialog/varval.asp?ma=PC003&lang=1|publisher=[[Statistics Estonia]]|accessdate=31 May 2013|date=31 December 2011}}</ref> [http://www.laiusepk.edu.ee/ Laiuse Middle School] is one of the oldest in Estonia, being established in 1822. Laiuse is the location of the medieval [[Laiuse church]]. The church was first mentioned in 1319. In the church yard, there's an old [[Tilia|lime]] tree, which was supposedly planted there by king [[Charles XII of Sweden]] during his visit in 1701. ==See also== *[[Laiuse Romani]] *[[Laiuse Castle]] *[[Laiuse church]] *[[Laiusevälja]] ==References== {{reflist}} {{Boroughs of Estonia}} {{Jõgeva Parish}} [[Category:Boroughs and small boroughs in Estonia]] [[Category:Castles of the Livonian Order]] {{jõgeva-geo-stub}}
